Vocabularies.Definition: n.天使
whatever may happen, in any case 无论如何，不管怎样
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. At any rate, you survived the car accident.

Vocabularies.Definition: (bet or betted) vt. be sure 敢说，确信
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I bet she was late for the meeting on purpose.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. hold (one's teeth, hands, etc.) together tightly 咬紧；握紧
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. clench one's teeth/fist

Vocabularies.Definition: (of a feeling) affect (指某种感觉) 刺激或影响
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. A great sense of calm came over me when I realized that I was no longer responsible for the situation.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the people living in one place, district, or country, considered as a whole 社区；社会
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Police work to prevent crime and to protect the lives and property or the people in a community.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. 组成，构成 consist of be made up of 由…组成
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The book consists of essays written over the last twenty years.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  without stopping; unchanging 持续的；不变的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I have had a constant headache for three days.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. （用作称呼）亲爱的；心爱的人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Are you free tonight, darling?

Vocabularies.Definition: n. （餐后）甜点心
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. She had homemade ice cream for dessert.

Vocabularies.Definition: 餐厅 dine vi. (fml)
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. They used to enjoy going out to dine.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  take (sb.'s attention) away from sth. esp. for a short time 转移（注意力）；使分心
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Tom admits that playing computer games sometimes distracts him form his homework.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. great fear 畏惧，恐怖
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. She has a dread of injections.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  foolish; unable to speak 愚蠢的；哑的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He was so dumb that he left his keys at home again.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. make (sb.) feel awkward or ashamed 使窘迫；使不好意思
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I chose my words carefully in order to avoid embarrassing anyone.

Vocabularies.Definition: int.  （用于表示迟疑、沉吟）哦，呃
a. unusual 杰出的，特别的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Ann showed an exceptional musical ability at the age of four.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. tire out; use up completely 使筋疲力尽；用完，耗尽
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He took to walking long distances in an attempt to physically exhaust himself.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. lose color or brightness; disappear slowly 褪色；变黯淡；消失
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The sunlight gradually faded.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  供应快餐的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. James works as an assistant chef at a fast-food restaurant.

Vocabularies.Definition: complete 填写
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Please fill out the application form and send it back by January 10.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  showing one's thoughts and feelings openly 坦白的，直率的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. To be frank with you, I think you are making a mistake.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. wonderful; splendid; having or deserving great fame and honor 极好的；辉煌的；光荣的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. It seems a pity to be indoors on such a glorious day.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 吉他
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. My brother plays the guitar in a rock band.

Vocabularies.Definition: give or leave to people who are younger or come later 把…传下去
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The art of story-telling is handed down from mother to daughter.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  make (sb.) feel ashamed or seem silly, esp. in public 羞辱，使丢脸
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. England were humiliated in last night's match.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 歇斯底里的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Clam down, you're getting hysterical.

Vocabularies.Definition: having control (over) or responsibility (for) 主管，负责
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The executive in charge of the project was having some difficulties in negotiating terms with the contractors.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 干涉；干扰
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Her parents' continual interference in our affairs irritated me.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  stop (sb.) from continuing what they are saying or doing. 打断…的讲话；中断…的行动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. My daughter kept interrupting me whenever I spoke.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. pull suddenly and quickly 猛地一扭（或一拉等）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He jerked the fishing-rod out of the water.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  younger, lower in rank than another 较年幼的；地位较低的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Jane is several years junior to her husband.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  （使）突出，伸出 jut out （使）突出，伸出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The northern end of the island juts out like a long, thin finger into the sea.

Vocabularies.Word: know better than (that / to do sth)
Vocabularies.Definition: be wise or well-trained enough not to do (sth.) 明事理而不至于(做某事)
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. You should know better than to argue with you mother.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a place or position 场所；位置
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Witnesses showed the police the exact location of the accident.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. （语调、色彩等的）单调
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The evidence was read out to the court in a dull monotone.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. say sth. in a way that others can not really hear the words 咕哝；含糊地说
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He mumbled something to me which I didn't quite catch.

Vocabularies.Definition: make (a list of things) smaller 减少，缩小
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Over a hundred applicants will be narrowed down to a short list of five candidates.

Vocabularies.Definition: int. (infml) 哎哟
ad.  in general 大体上 a.  including everything; total 包括一切的；总计的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The college has few ways to assess the quality of education overall.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  手掌
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He knew the route of the journey like the palm of his hand.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  耐心，忍耐
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. My patience is quite worn out.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (AmE) （高中或大学等的）班级舞会
n. 证据，证明
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The executive produced documents in proof of this claim.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  烹饪法；秘诀
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. What is your recipe for success?

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. again and again 反复地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We have repeatedly requested that staff should not be allowed to smoke in the office.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  at exactly the same time 同时地 simultaneous a.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The two guns fired almost simultaneously.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  蹲
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We squatted beside the pool and watched the diver sink slowly down.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 悬念 keep (sb.) in suspense delay telling (sb.) what they are eager to know 使产生悬念，故意迟迟不告诉
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The audience is kept in suspense to the very end of the play.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  吞，咽
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I tried to swallow, but my mouth was too dry.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. gifted 有才能的；天才的 talent n. 才能，天才
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Jackie Chen has a huge army of young fans, and is extremely talented.

Vocabularies.Definition: 用（一物）交换（另一物）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The farmers traded farm produce for manufactured goods and money.

Vocabularies.Definition: int. 嗯，唔
n.  一致；齐唱；齐奏 in unison acting in the same way at the same time 一致地；一起
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The children find it difficult to play their instruments in unison.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  疫苗接种
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Anyone who wants to avoid the flu should consider getting a vaccination.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 福利；幸福
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Parents are responsible for the welfare of their children.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. (infml) yes

Vocabularies.Word: know better than (that / to do sth)
